CodeChef
Sherlock and Inversions
D. Impressive Queries

Fenvika
#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int a[100001];
int t[100001];
int sum(int ind) {
    int res = 0;
    for (int i = ind; i > 0; i = (i & (i-1))) {
        res += t[i];
    }
    return res;
}
int sum(int L, int R) {
    return sum(R)-sum(L-1);
}
int n;
void update(int ind, int delta) {
    for (int i = ind; i <= n; i = (i | (i-1))+1) {
        t[i] += delta;
    }
}
int main() {
    cin >> n;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        cin >> a[i];
        update(i, a[i]);
    }
    int m;
    cin >> m;
    for (int i = 1; i <= m; i++) {
        int t;
        cin >> t;
        if (t==1) {
            int L, R;
            cin >> L >> R;
            cout << sum(L, R) << endl;
        }
        else {
            int ind, delta;
            cin >> ind >> delta;
            update(ind, delta);

        }
    }

}

/*
5
1 2 3 4 5
5
1 1 3
2 2 6
1 1 3
2 4 3
1 1 5

6
12
24
*/
Inversiya
#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int a[100001];
int t[100001];
int sum(int ind) {
    int res = 0;
    for (int i = ind; i > 0; i = (i & (i-1))) {
        res += t[i];
    }
    return res;
}
int sum(int L, int R) {
    return sum(R)-sum(L-1);
}
int n;
void update(int ind, int delta) {
    for (int i = ind; i <= n; i = (i | (i-1))+1) {
        t[i] += delta;
    }
}
int main() {
    cin >> n;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        cin >> a[i];
    }
    long long inv = 0;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        inv += sum(a[i]+1, n);
        update(a[i], 1);
        cout << sum(a[i]+1, n) << endl;
    }
    cout << inv;
}

/*
6
5 3 3 4 1 2
5
1 1 3
2 2 6
1 1 3
2 4 3
1 1 5

6
12
24
*/
Ikki o'lchamli Fenvika
#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int a[1001][1001];
int t[1001][1001];
int sum(int x, int y) {
    int res = 0;
    for (int i = x; i > 0; i = (i & (i-1))) {
        for (int j = y; j > 0; j = (j & (j-1))) {
            res += t[i][j];
        }
    }
    return res;
}
int sum(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2) {
    return sum(x2, y2) — sum(x2, y1-1) — sum(x1-1, y2) + sum(x1-1, y1-1);
}
int n, m;
void update(int x, int y, int delta) {
    for (int i = x; i <= n; i = (i | (i-1))+1) {
        for (int j = y; j <= m; j = (j | (j-1))+1) {
            t[i][j] += delta;
        }
    }
}
int main() {
    cin >> n;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        cin >> a[i];
        update(i, a[i]);
    }
    int m;
    cin >> m;
    for (int i = 1; i <= m; i++) {
        int t;
        cin >> t;
        if (t==1) {
            int L, R;
            cin >> L >> R;
            cout << sum(L, R) << endl;
        }
        else {
            int ind, delta;
            cin >> ind >> delta;
            update(ind, delta);

        }
    }

}

/*
5
1 2 3 4 5
5
1 1 3
2 2 6
1 1 3
2 4 3
1 1 5

6
12
24
*/
